definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Inside the Wolf's foot, the stony horizon.
sentences.chinese: 在狼的蹄子内部，是石头遍布的地平线。

sentences.english: Smelly wiped the clay off her trotters on the mat and came over.
sentences.chinese: 臭臭把蹄子上粘的泥土在垫子上蹭干净，然后走过来。

sentences.english: I also might kick with my big, heavy hoofs.
sentences.chinese: 我也能用我那又大又沉的蹄子来踢。

sentences.english: My strong hooves could stamp broken the wolf’s head.
sentences.chinese: 我的蹄子能踢碎狼的脑袋。

sentences.english: The horse's hooves are to protect their feet as so to gallop steadily on the snow-covered ground.
sentences.chinese: 马有蹄子保护它的脚，安稳地跑过霜雪覆盖的地面。

sentences.english: The horse pawed the dust of the street.
sentences.chinese: 这匹马用蹄子刨街上的尘土。

sentences.english: Once he pulled something in his hoof two days before a big competition.
sentences.chinese: 有一次在一场大型比赛前2天，他拉伤了他的蹄子。

sentences.english: Besides, the animals found it hard to keep their toes from under his heavy hoofs.
sentences.chinese: 加上骆驼的蹄子老是踩中其他动物的趾头。

sentences.english: The prancing and pawing of each little hoof.
sentences.chinese: 有小蹄子腾跃踢踏的响声。

sentences.english: A man trying to sell a blind horse always praises its feet.
sentences.chinese: 卖瞎马的人总夸马的蹄子好。

sentences.english: The horse snorted and stamped its hoof impatiently.
sentences.chinese: 这匹马呼哧呼哧地喷着气，不耐烦地跺着蹄子。

definition: to whinny (of a horse)/to neigh/to shout
(of mules, horses etc) to kick backward/to kick with the hind legs/fig. to flare up in anger/to display defiance
animals used for their physical strength (mules, oxen etc)/beast of burden
